main_text.sentence: When compared to gSSRs, EST derived SSRs (EST-SSRs) were less polymorphic in a study in hexaploid wheat [9] with only 25% polymorphism, but the successful markers were of high quality and were also polymorphic in durum wheat.

Estimated polymorphism parameters included: number of polymorphic sites (S); haplotype diversity (HT) considering as haplotype each different sequence; nucleotide diversity (π) [18]; and average number of pairwise differences between sequences (k).

However, among two polymorphic sites tested at the vitamin D receptor (VDR) gene, the Fok I(+) allele of the FokI/restriction fragment length polymorphism was found to be associated with higher risk HT in Japanese females [209].

Susceptibility to scrapie is largely controlled by three polymorphic amino acid positions (136, 154, 171) of the ovine prion protein gene (prnp) [4] and reliable genotyping of the corresponding DNA polymorphism is required as a basis for selection decisions.
Recently, 33 polymorphic tandem repeats (TRs) of P. vivax and a P. vivax polymorphic microsatellite have been identified and shown to be useful in population studies [9,10].

An inventory of case-control studies based on the association between three polymorphic markers within the CTLA-4 gene [A49G dimorphism in the leader peptide, C (-318) T substitution in the promoter region and a dinucleotide repeat polymorphism at the 3'-untranslated region (3'-UTR)] and HT is reviewed in [165].

source_text.title: Isolation of EST-derived microsatellite markers for genotyping the A and B genomes of wheat
